column4: Hello, I am having ttrouble making log files. It is probably a simple answer, but someone could help me here, I would appreciate it. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1230796
auth.log.1 is logrotate rotating the logs
okay. about the rest of my question though?
auth.log will be the file with the latest entries in
no, i believe fail2ban will only use auth.log (or the one file you specify)
but why when i start sshd, it doesnt make nor try to access my auth.log file?
try restarting syslog instead
see what happens then
and remove the auth.log-file you've created
so, to summarize.. remove auth.log and restart syslog
okay. so stop it and remove all auto.log* files?
yup
auth.log*
* Reloading system log daemon...                                        [fail]
do you know why it is failing to restart syslogd?
check your logs ;)
that was the phun :p
but try stopping it and the starting it
I re ran the syslogdaemon, and reran sshd, still did not make the .log file
try logging in and see what happens?
and give it time to flush the log entries to disk
relogged in. "sudo nano /etc/log/auth.log" gives me "New File", and if I tab on "auth", it doesnt give me any options
do you know anything else I should try to fix my log problem?
